name: ShirtGraphic
type: class
memorycategory: Instances
summary: |
  Applies a texture to the front surface of a character's torso, used to display
  t-shirts.
description: |
  The ShirtGraphic object applies a texture to the front surface of a
  character's torso. It is used to display t-shirts.
codesamples: []
inherits:
  - CharacterAppearance
descendants: []
tags: []
deprecationmessage: ''
properties:
  - name: ShirtGraphic.Color3
    summary: |
      Determines the colorization to be applied to the Class.ShirtGraphic
      texture.
    description: |
      This property determines the colorization to be applied to the
      Class.ShirtGraphic texture. It functions similarly to
      Class.ImageLabel.ImageColor3 except that it is applied to
      Class.ShirtGraphic textures. This is useful for creating shirt graphics
      that have many different color variations but share the same basic look.

      See also:

      - Class.Clothing.Color3 which determines the colorization to be applied
        to the Class.Clothing texture
    codesamples: []
    type: Color3
    tags: []
    deprecationmessage: ''
    security:
      read: None
      write: None
    threadsafety: ReadSafe
    category: Appearance
    serialization:
      canload: true
      cansave: true
    capabilities:
      - Avatar
  - name: ShirtGraphic.Graphic
    summary: |
      The content ID link pointing to the Class.ShirtGraphic texture hosted on
      the Roblox website. This property sets the texture associated with a
      t-shirt.
    description: |
      The content ID link pointing to the Class.ShirtGraphic texture hosted on
      the Roblox website. This property sets the texture associated with a
      t-shirt.

      #### Finding the ID

      This content ID is different than the website URL of the t-shirt. It can
      be found by pasting the website URL of the t-shirt into the Graphic
      property of the Class.ShirtGraphic in Roblox Studio, as Studio will
      correct it. Alternatively Class.InsertService:LoadAsset() can be used to
      insert the t-shirt into the workspace, for example:


      local InsertService = game:GetService("InsertService")
      local Workspace = game:GetService("Workspace")

      local webURL = "https://www.roblox.com/catalog/2591161/Sword-Fight-on-the-Heights-Ring-of-Fire-T-Shirt"
      local assetId = tonumber(string.match(webURL, "%d+") or 0)  -- Extract the number

      local success, model = pcall(function()
      	return InsertService:LoadAsset(assetId)
      end)

      if success then
      	model.Parent = Workspace
      end

    codesamples: []
    type: ContentId
    tags: []
    deprecationmessage: ''
    security:
      read: None
      write: None
    threadsafety: ReadSafe
    category: Appearance
    serialization:
      canload: true
      cansave: true
    capabilities:
      - Avatar
